ad_saravana_kumar wrote:
> Hi,
> 
>       I am running two instance of Heritrix to crawl 300 urls from a
> site.  Each instance giving different set of urls.  But 70% of urls
> are same.  I need both crawlers need to give same set of urls.  If
> there any option in Heritrix like whenever we crawl a site it will
> always give same set of urls.  

Two crawlers, given the exact same seeds and initial configuration, 
started at the exact same time, should get the same material EXCEPT in 
cases where the network and sites themselves vary from moment to moment 
or client to client.

For example, sites might randomize their content on certain pages, give 
different answers to different IP addresses, have intermittent errors, 
and so forth. Even the slight jitter in successful fetch delays could 
mean that on one run, a URI is discovered once via one path, and then on 
the other crawl, via another path. (And because Heritrix sends a 
'Referer' value, the sites themselves may again choose to answer these 
arrivals via different paths differently.)

So even though the Heritrix software itself is deterministic, the 
internet it collects is not. You would have to analyze your logs and 
collected material to find the initial points of divergence.

- Gordon @ IA
